subject: Travel
title: Dunhuang and the Cave of Scrolls
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Dunhuang and the Cave of Scrolls.

hook.text: In 1900, a Taoist monk stumbled into a sealed cave near Dunhuang, China. It was packed with scrolls.

buildup.text: The cave contained 50,000 manuscripts in Chinese, Tibetan, Sanskrit, and languages now extinct.

discovery.text: Among them was the Diamond Sutra, printed in 868 AD â€” the world's oldest dated printed book.

twist.text: British explorer Aurel Stein bought thousands of scrolls for a pittance. China calls it theft.

climax.text: The scrolls are now scattered across museums in London, Paris, and Beijing.

punchline.text: A hidden cave preserved a library for a thousand years.

quiz.question: What was the oldest dated printed book found in the Dunhuang cave?
